question: who was the head of the spanish inquisition
api_result: The head of the Spanish Inquisition was known as the "Inquisitor General." The most famous Inquisitor General was Tomás de Torquemada, who served from 1483 to 1498. He played a significant role in the establishment and expansion of the Inquisition in Spain, particularly targeting converted Jews and Muslims suspected of heresy. The position of Inquisitor General was held by various individuals over the years, but Torquemada is often the most recognized figure associated with the Spanish Inquisition.
